snippet: The Times columnist Joe Nocera ran into Jamie Dimon in an elevator, and the results weren't pretty. "Why does The New York Times hate the banks?" the JPMorgan Chase chief asked, according to Mr. Nocera. But the problem, Mr. Nocera maintains, lies in...
abstract: The Times columnist Joe Nocera ran into Jamie Dimon in an elevator, and the results weren't pretty. "Why does The New York Times hate the banks?" the JPMorgan Chase chief asked, according to Mr. Nocera. But the problem, Mr. Nocera maintains, lies in a pattern of "awful behavior" inside the credit card collection wings of banks like JPMorgan. "It's the country that hates the banks these days," he writes.
